pullRequest.body:
Given a function differentiable at a point, the result of adding a second function is differentiable (there) iff the second function is differentiable (there).

---
The part that's new is: at a point, the sum of a differentiable and a non-differentiable function is non-differentiable.
The other direction of the `iff` is already covered by `DifferentiableAt.add`.

Lemmas are marked `@[simp]` because other `iff` lemmas in that file are marked as such.

Needed for #9734 

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks, and is labeled with `awaiting-review`.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph

|Files|Import difference|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ Differentiable.add_iff_left`
`+ Differentiable.add_iff_right`
`+ Differentiable.sub_iff_left`
`+ Differentiable.sub_iff_right`
`+ DifferentiableAt.add_iff_left`
`+ DifferentiableAt.add_iff_right`
`+ DifferentiableAt.sub_iff_left`
`+ DifferentiableAt.sub_iff_right`
`+ DifferentiableOn.add_iff_left`
`+ DifferentiableOn.add_iff_right`
`+ DifferentiableOn.sub_iff_left`
`+ DifferentiableOn.sub_iff_right`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

</details>
Let's test if `@[simp]` causes troubles.
!bench
@YaelDillies Could you please remind me what's our convention about `left`/`right` in lemmas like these?

Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/e3bc57b4-8a53-4f0c-839e-caa7933e249b) for commit a839b0276285355a3c28e862b7f6113fdcc77cf4.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/fec8d78f-ea43-4ac8-be7f-ee1ee74d2e56/to/e3bc57b4-8a53-4f0c-839e-caa7933e249b) against commit 5e75b544a6f0ef4a7804c87b28179ef4301108a2.

LGTM but I don't remember what's our convention about `left`/`right` here, so delegating to Yael who probably remembers it.
bors d=@YaelDillies

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> Can you add the corresponding `sub` lemmas?

Now the linter complains that old lemmas  (which concern the special case of subtracting constant) can be proved by simp. What to do?
- Do not mark `sub_iff_*` as `@[simp]`
- Remove the `@[simp]` mark from the old lemmas
- ?

Remove the simp from the old lemmas (/deprecate the old lemmas since they are superseded?)

Can you also add the `DifferentiableOn` version of your new lemmas?
🚀 Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
This PR was included in a batch that was canceled, it will be automatically retried

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9909625500/job/27378099988)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9909625500/job/27378100867)
bors merge

`binOp_iff_left` should be of the form `P (binOp f g) \iff P f`, and `binOp_iff_right` should be of the form `P (binOp f g) \iff P g`.

Can you add the corresponding `sub` lemmas?

Thanks!

maintainer merge
bors merge

Not tested, but should work:
```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun h ↦ ?_, fun hf ↦ hf.add hg⟩
  simpa using h.sub hg
```

```suggestion
  simp only [add_comm (f _), hg.add_iff_left]
```

Please add `(since := ... )` clauses to your deprecation. Note that we have a `deprecated alias` code snippet to help you with this (although currently it doesn't do exactly what you want here)
```suggestion
@[deprecated DifferentiableAt.sub_iff_left (since := 2024-07-11)]
```

Also please golf the proof of the lemmas you deprecate so that people know how to replace the deprecated lemmas by the non-deprecated ones

If you didn't know about this, this is called dot notation and is the entire point of naming lemmas about `FancyProp` like `FancyProp.add`, `FancyProp.neg`, ...
```suggestion
  (differentiableAt_const _).sub_iff_left 
```
Thanks. I did know about this but just "copy pasted" without thinking.

```suggestion
  simp [sub_eq_add_neg, hg]
```
should work, hopefully. If it doesn't, please make it work by adding `DifferentiableAt 𝕜 (fun y => -f y) ↔ DifferentiableAt 𝕜 f x` as a simp lemma
Does work. Replaced by `simp only` instead because I'm guessing it's faster and more stable to future changes.
Faster, a bit. More stable to future changes, not necessarily since `simp only` requires you to name lemmas which might be renamed in the future

> `simp only` requires you to name lemmas which might be renamed in the future

I would think renaming lemmas is much easier than figuring out which new `simp` lemma is now preventing a proof from working and why.
In my experience, not necessarily, no. Further, renamings happen much more often than terminal simp calls not working anymore

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Lemmas `DifferentiableAt.add_iff_left`, `DifferentiableAt.add_iff_right`
